children.name: postgraduate
children.definition: / graduatemainly US  describes university studies or students at a more advanced level than a first degree :sau đại học, cao học

children.name: updating...
examples: postgraduate studies/ research/ students
a postgraduate degreeinmicrobiology

children.name: vocational
children.definition: vocational training or schools teach you the skills to do a particular job:nghề
examples: Not all the courses are purely vocational.
The Job Corps is a vocational training program for low-income youths.
The Swedes regard vocationaltrainingas a part of a youngster's education.

children.name: secondary
children.definition: relating to the education of children approximately between the ages of 11 and 18 years old : trung học

children.name: updating...
examples: secondary education/ schooling/ teaching etc
secondaryeducation
Marcus has just started at secondaryschool.

children.name: higher education
children.definition: education at a university or similar institution: giáo dục đại học
examples: The U.S. community college system is the largest system of higher education in the world.
More women than ever are going on to higher education.

children.name: updating...
examples: further education[U]UK(abbFE) education for adults after leaving school, that is not at a university
I did a carpentry course at the further education college.

children.name: updating...
examples: tertiary educationC1[U] formaleducation at a college, university etc

children.name: graduation
children.definition: 1 the time when you complete a university degree course or your education at an American high school :
examples: After graduation Neil returned to Ohio.
On graduation(= after completing a first degree ), Nancy became an art teacher.

children.name: updating...
examples: graduation [U] a ceremony at which you receive a university degree or a diploma from an American high school :
graduation day
a graduation ceremony

children.name: education
children.definition: the process of teaching and learning, usually at school, college, or university :
examples: She also hopes her children will get a good education.
efforts to improve girls’ access to education

children.name: updating...
examples: education[U] the institutions and people involved with teaching :
the local education authority

children.name: updating...
examples: a good educationAll parents want a good education for their children.

children.name: updating...
examples: a poor education(= not very good )She had a poor education, and left school without qualifications.

children.name: updating...
examples: an all-round education(= including a balance of lots of different subjects )The school offers a good all-round education.

children.name: updating...
examples: full-time education(= spending every weekday in a school or college )Children must stay in full-time education until the age of 16.

children.name: updating...
examples: state educationBritish English,public educationAmerican English(= provided by the government of a country )The state of California guarantees free public education to all children.

children.name: updating...
examples: private education(= that people have to pay for )I don't agree with the principle of private education.

children.name: updating...
examples: formal educationC1(= from teachers at school or college, rather than learning by yourself )She had no formal education and was brought up by her grandmother.

children.name: updating...
examples: primary (school) educationBritish English,elementary educationAmerican English(= for children aged between 5 and 11 )The government has announced plans to improve the quality of primary school education.

children.name: updating...
examples: secondary education(alsohigh school educationAmerican English) (= for children aged between 11 and 18 )She hopes to start a teaching career in secondary education.

children.name: updating...
examples: university/college educationDo you have a university education?

children.name: updating...
examples: further/higher education(= at a college or university )I did a carpentry course at the further education college.

children.name: updating...
examples: tertiary educationC1[U] formaleducation at a college, university etc

children.name: updating...
examples: adult education(= for adults )They run adult education classes at the local community college.

children.name: updating...
examples: vocational education(= relating to skills needed for a particular job )We offer vocational education and job training.

children.name: updating...
examples: nursery/pre-school education(= for children aged under 5 )The funding will provide nursery education for all four-year-olds.

children.name: updating...
examples: have an educationThe women have had little education.

children.name: updating...
examples: get/receive an educationSome children grow up without receiving any education.

children.name: updating...
examples: give/provide an educationThe school aims to provide a good general education.

children.name: updating...
examples: enter education(= start going to school, college etc )The number of students entering higher education has risen.

children.name: updating...
examples: leave educationBritish English(= stop going to school, college etc )She left full-time education at the age of 16.

children.name: updating...
examples: continue your educationI hope to continue my education after high school.

children.name: updating...
examples: the education system(= the way education is organized and managed in a country )Is the British education system failing some children?

children.name: updating...
examples: the education department(= the government organization that makes decisions about education )Newcastle City Council’s education department

children.name: updating...
examples: an education authority(= a government organization that makes official decisions about education in one particular area )The school is funded by the local education authority.

children.name: updating...
examples: the education service(= all the government organizations that work together to provide education )There are plans to expand the adult education service.

children.name: updating...
examples: education policy(= political plans for managing an education system )The teaching unions are calling for the government to review its education policy.

children.name: updating...
examples: education reform(= changes that a government makes to the education system in a country )the government’s programme of education reform

children.name: updating...
examples: educational[usually attri adj] [B2] relating to education:giáo dục

children.name: updating...
examples: Different children have different educational needs.

children.name: updating...
examples: We offer a wide range of educational and sporting activities.

children.name: updating...
examples: educational institution/establishmenta school, college, or universitycơ sở giáo dục

children.name: updating...
examples: Many educational institutions have not been able make needed improvements because of funding cuts.

children.name: updating...
examples: educational system

children.name: updating...
examples: The American educational system is in need of reform.

children.name: updating...
examples: educational opportunity

children.name: updating...
examples: Low-income children do not have the same educational opportunities as children from wealthier families.

children.name: schooling
children.definition: education at school : giáo dục ở nhà trường
examples: Jack didn't receive much formal schooling.
children in their final year of compulsory schooling(= the time during which children have to attend school by law )
Al’s dad had only a few years of schooling.

children.name: academic
children.definition: 1 relating to education, especially at college or university levelOPP non-: học thuật
examples: He possessed no academic qualifications.
a program to raise academic standards

children.name: updating...
examples: academic [ usually before noun ] concerned with studying from books, as opposed to practical work : học thuật hơn là thực hành
the study of art as an academic discipline

children.name: updating...
examples: academic qualificationsHe had the right experience and academic qualifications for the job.

children.name: updating...
examples: academic performancePersonal problems may affect a student’s academic performance.

children.name: updating...
examples: academic achievementsGirls’ academic achievements are at least as good as boys’.

children.name: updating...
examples: academic standards(= levels that are considered to be acceptable )The school has high academic standards.

children.name: updating...
examples: academic research(= study of a subject, in order to discover new facts or test new ideas )Many academic research projects take years to complete.

children.name: updating...
examples: academic studyAfter academic study, you have to gain practical experience.

children.name: updating...
examples: an academic subjectChildren who are not good at academic subjects may excel in music or sport.

children.name: updating...
examples: an academic discipline(= a subject that is studied at university )the academic disciplines of linguistics, psychology and sociology

children.name: updating...
examples: an academic careerShe wanted to pursue an academic career.

children.name: updating...
examples: the academic year(= the time within a period of 12 months when students are studying at a school or university )Language students spend the third academic year abroad.

children.name: updating...
examples: the academic world(= the institutions, people etc involved in education )In the academic world, the theory was received less approvingly.

children.name: updating...
examples: academic freedom(= the freedom to study what you want )There is concern for the academic freedom of both staff and students.

children.name: grant
children.definition: money that the government gives to someone to help them pay for their education:trợ cấp (giáo dục)
examples: Will I get a grant, even though both my parents are earning?

children.name: updating...
examples: student grant: học bổng
Without a student grant, I’d never even have gone into higher education.

children.name: scholarship
children.definition: money that a student received from theirschool,collegeetc to pay for their education, especially because they have passed a special examination:học bổng
examples: The Foundation’s goals include providing scholarships for gifted young students.
Admitted to Mills College on a full scholarship, she graduated Phi Beta Kappa without a penny of help from her parents.

children.name: updating...
examples: scholarship to
Shewonascholarshipto Iowa State University.

children.name: updating...
examples: college scholarship
The company has a small number of college scholarships to offer to employees’ children.

children.name: updating...
examples: athletic/drama/music etc scholarshipa scholarship given to sb who is very good at sport, acting, music etc
I attended the University of Houston on an athletic scholarship.
At 9, he became a boy soprano, beginning a six-year music scholarship in a cathedral choir.

children.name: updating...
examples: win/be awarded a scholarship
When she was 18, she won a scholarship to study at the Conservatoire in Paris.
We’re very proud of the five students from this school who were awarded scholarships.

children.name: updating...
examples: on a scholarship
He attended college on a drama scholarship.
